page.title: 02The Mackintosh of Moy
page.content: The fragmented nature of the Highlands with its glens divided by mountain barriers gave rise to small scattered communities and largely created the need for the Clan System. STRATHDEARN valley of the Findhorn heartland of the Mackintoshes well illustrates this. MOY ESTATE has remained in the Mackintosh of Mackintosh family since 1336 when the Bishop of Moray granted the Barony of Moy to William 7th Chief of Mackintosh. The original name of the area was STARSACH NA GAL-Threshold of the Highlands. The hills rise around Moy while the ground to the north falls away to the Moray Firth. The present Chief,Lachlan,30th Chief lives in the present Moy Hall. He takes part in public life in the Highlands and was awarded an O.B.E.
